block.p: Marjorie Armstrong Taylor, the daughter of Mary Scott Kendall of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, and the late Carter Taylor, was married last evening to Joseph Robert Nachman Jr., a son of Penelope Stout Strakhov of Bedminister, N.J., and Mr. Nachman Sr. of New York. Belinda Jimenez, the chief judge of the department of civil registry in Puerto Vallarta, officiated at Hacienda Cora, a hotel there.

Mrs. Nachman, 28, is known as Honey. She is the communications manager for FamilyPC magazine in New York. She graduated from Vanderbilt University. Her father was a real estate agent for Boalt Properties, which was in Palm Beach, Fla. Her mother retired as a saleswoman at Donald Bruce, a gift shop in Palm Beach. The bride's stepfather, Messmore Kendall, retired as the owner of Kendall Investments, also in Palm Beach.

Marjorie Armstrong Taylor, the daughter of Mary Scott Kendall of Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, and the late Carter Taylor, was married last evening to Joseph Robert Nachman Jr., a son of Penelope Stout Strakhov of Bedminister, N.J., and Mr. Nachman Sr. of New York. Belinda Jimenez, the chief judge of the department of civil registry in Puerto Vallarta, officiated at Hacienda Cora, a hotel there.

Mrs. Nachman, 28, is known as Honey. She is the communications manager for FamilyPC magazine in New York. She graduated from Vanderbilt University. Her father was a real estate agent for Boalt Properties, which was in Palm Beach, Fla. Her mother retired as a saleswoman at Donald Bruce, a gift shop in Palm Beach. The bride's stepfather, Messmore Kendall, retired as the owner of Kendall Investments, also in Palm Beach.

Mr. Nachman, also 28, is known as Jed. He is a senior account executive in New York for Hotjobs.com, a job listings service on the Internet. He graduated from the University of Colorado at Boulder. His mother owns Penny Annie, a wallpaper and fabric store in Fair Haven, N.J. His father is an investment consultant in New York with the private client services division of Deutsche Banc Alex. Brown.
